intro: Rhynchospora exaltata var. microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed spikegrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This variant is characterized by its compact inflorescence and small, rounded flower heads. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes and wet meadows. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
